Package org.gearvrf.animation

GVRF animations, version 2.0.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    GVRInterpolator
    Allows you to override the normal, linear animation.
    GVROnFinish
    Optional on-finish callback
    GVROnRepeat
    Optional on-finish callback, with options for controlling repetition
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    GVRAccelerateDecelerateInterpolator
    An interpolator that initially accelerates; runs at fairly steady speed; then finally decelerates.
    GVRAnimation
    The root of the GVRF animation tree.
    GVRAnimationEngine
    This class runs animations.
    GVRColorAnimation
    Animate the overlay color.
    GVRMaterialAnimation
    Animate a GVRMaterial.
    GVROpacityAnimation
    Animate the opacity.
    GVRPostEffectAnimation
    Animate a GVRPostEffect.
    GVRRelativeMotionAnimation
    Animate an object's position.
    GVRRepeatMode
    The three supported repeat modes.
    GVRRotationByAxisAnimation
    Rotation animation.
    GVRRotationByAxisWithPivotAnimation
    This animation uses GVRTransform.rotateByAxisWithPivot(float, float, float, float, float, float, float) to do an animated rotation about a specific axis, with a specific pivot point.
    GVRScaleAnimation
    Size animation.
    GVRTransformAnimation
    Animate a GVRTransform.

Package org.gearvrf.animation Description

GVRF animations, version 2.0.

You can animate any GVRF object's properties. By default, when you start an animation it runs once and terminates, without any need for further action on your part. You can, however, specify an on-finish callback; you can specify a repeat count and/or a repeat mode; you can even specify an on-repeat callback that lets you run an animation until your app reaches a desired state.

The animation engine is an optional part of GVRF; you need to create an instance of the animation engine. See GVRAnimation for the details, but the general use model is

  • new an animation, supplying the required parameters
  • optionally, override any or all of the default parameters
  • start the animation by calling start(animationEngine)
Version:
2.0
